emergencyContacts.title: Emergency Contacts
emergencyContacts.info1: Keep the phone numbers for reliable immigration legal aid organizations handy. They can explain your rights, connect you with attorneys, and guide you through ICE encounters.
emergencyContacts.info2: Identify local immigrant or rapid-response groups that can assist if someone is detained. They may provide on-the-ground support, advocacy, and connections to bail or legal resources.
emergencyContacts.info3: Make sure at least one friend, family member, or trusted person knows your location and can check in if needed.
emergencyContacts.top: Keeping important contacts accessible can help you and your loved ones stay safe in unexpected situations.
emergencyContacts.bottom: Store these numbers in your phone, in a wallet, or on a ‚ÄúKnow Your Rights‚Äù card. Consider keeping a small paper list as backup in case your phone is lost or confiscated.

knowYourRights.title: Know Your Rights
knowYourRights.infoD1: You do not have to answer questions about your immigration status, where you were born, or your citizenship.
knowYourRights.infoD2: You do not have to show documents unless you are driving a vehicle and legally required to show your license and registration.
knowYourRights.infoD3: You have the right to refuse searches. You do not have to consent to a search of yourself, your belongings, or your home without a warrant.
knowYourRights.infoD4: You have the right to speak with a lawyer before answering questions.
knowYourRights.infoD5: Never sign documents from ICE without consulting a lawyer.
knowYourRights.infoD6: If detained, you have the right to make a phone call to a lawyer or trusted contact.

footer.disclaimer: For immediate emergencies, contact local emergency services. For immigration legal help, contact qualified legal aid organizations.

aboutPage.title: About Us
aboutPage.description: Community-driven protection for the neighborhoods we call home
aboutPage.missionDescription: We are UC San Diego alumni who grew up in Los Angeles and share a deep appreciation towards the community that shaped us. Iceinmyarea.org was created from our desire to use the education and opportunities we've been fortunate to receive to give back to neighborhoods, friends, and families that helped us grow. Our mission is to help keep our communities informed, connected, and safe. For us, this is much more than a project, it is a way to protect and uplift the city that we admire and the neighbors we care about.

resourcesPage.subTitle1: Steps to Take if a Loved One is Detained

resource1.title: Confirming Detainment by ICE
resource1.description: Use the ICE Detainee Locator System to confirm their location and status. Have the person's full name, date of birth, and country of origin ready.

resource2.title: Reach Your Loved One
resource2.description: Find detention facility contact information, visitation rules, and communication guidelines to stay connected with detained loved ones.

resource3.title: Find Legal Help Near You
resource3.description: Search the National Immigration Legal Services Directory to locate free or low-cost legal aid organizations across the U.S.

resource4.title: Carry Your Rights With You
resource4.description: Wallet-sized Know Your Rights card from the Immigrant Legal Resource Center (ILRC). Available in multiple languages.
